name: src/EventEmitter.js
ANY
description:
A wildcard event; this was previously implemented as a symbol for consumers to import.
Since it is unclear whether strings are fine, we'll keep this around for now.

name: EXTENSIONS
description: Since ECMAScript currently lacks private fields, we will use this symbol to store internal properties. This allows consumers to use any property they want.

name: assertInstance
description: Performs a type assertion to ensure the API is used correctly.

params.name: unknown
params.description: An unknown paramater that should be type-checked

params.name: constructor
params.description: The constructor function that will be used in an `instanceof` type check

params.name: details
params.description: Details to append in the error message.

throws.description: when `unknown` is not an instance of `constructor`.

name: EventEmitter
description: A base class to extend to create event emitters. Event emitters are objects that can register event handlers that are run when a certain event is emitted.

params.name: options.inferListeners
params.description:
If `true`, this will automatically try to call a method `onX` if the event `x` is emitted. If the event `*` is emitted, this will try to call `onAny`.

If `false`, you will have to bind every listener manually.

throws.description: when `options` is not an instance of `Object`

name: [EXTENSIONS]
description: For all intents and purposes, this should be considered a private implementation detail until ECMAScript supports private fields.

properties.name: this[EXTENSIONS].events
properties.description: The internal storage for event listeners

name: addEventListener
description:
Adds a new event listener identified by `event`, which causes `callback` to be called when `event` is emitted.

Using the wildcard event `*` causes the `callback` to be called whenever an event emission occurs, regardless of its name.

params.name: event
params.description: An identifier to refer to the event

params.name: callback
params.description: A function that is called when the event is emitted

return.description: The instance that the event listener was added to.

throws.description: when `callback` is not an instance of `Function`

params.name: event
params.description: An identifier to refer to the event

params.name: callback
params.description: A function that is called when the event is emitted

return.description: The instance that the event listener was added to.

name: once
description: Identical to {@link addEventListener}, with the only difference that the event listener is automatically removed the first time the `callback` is called.

params.name: event
params.description: An identifier to refer to the event

params.name: callback
params.description: A function that is called when the event is emitted

return.description: The instance that the event listener was added to.

throws.description: when `callback` is not an instance of `Function`

name: removeEventListeners
description:
Removes all event listeners for a given `event`.

Note that this does not require a reference to any specific callback.

If there aren't any event listeners for `event`, a call to this method has no effect.

params.name: event
params.description: An identifier to refer to the event

return.description: The instance that the event listeners were removed from.

name: removeEventListener
description:
Removes a single even listener identified by `event` and a `callback`.

If there aren't any event listeners for `event`, a call to this method has no effect.

Using the wildcard event `*` will be equivalent to {@link removeEventListeners}.

params.name: event
params.description: An identifier to refer to event

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function that was used to create the event listener.

If the wildcard event `*` is used, the `callback` is optional.

return.description: The instance that the event listener was removed from.

throws.description: when `callback` is not an instance of `Function`

params.name: event
params.description: An identifier to refer to event

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function that was used to create the event listener.

If the wildcard event `*` is used, the `callback` is optional.

return.description: The instance that the event listener was removed from.

name: emit
description: Emits the event `event` causing all its registered callbacks to be called using the arguments `args`.

params.name: event
params.description: An identifier to refer to event

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments to use when calling the event listeners for `event`.

return.description: The instance that was used to emit the event.

name: src/index.js
./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "crystal-event-emitter",
  "version": "2.1.5",
  "description": "A small, modern event emitter base class with no dependencies",
  "main": "dist/index.js",
  "files": [
    "dist/*"
  ],
  "registry": "npm",
  "keywords": [
    "event",
    "emitter",
    "crystal",
    "esnext",
    "es2015",
    "es2016",
    "es2017",
    "es6",
    "modern"
  ],
  "scripts": {
    "check-commit": "npm test && npm run lint",
    "compile": "babel src -d dist",
    "coverage": "nyc npm test",
    "doc": "esdoc",
    "lint": "eslint src",
    "test": "ava",
    "prepublishOnly": "npm run check-commit"
  },
  "author": "kdex",
  "license": "GPL-3.0",
  "dependencies": {},
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/cli": "^7.0.0-beta.49",
    "@babel/core": "^7.0.0-beta.49",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.0.0-beta.49",
    "@babel/register": "^7.0.0-beta.49",
    "ava": "^1.0.0-beta.3",
    "babel-eslint": "^8.2.3",
    "babel-plugin-module-resolver": "^3.1.1",
    "codecov": "^3.0.0",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^4.19.1",
    "eslint-plugin-filenames": "^1.2.0",
    "greenkeeper-lockfile": "^1.15.1",
    "nyc": "^12.0.1"
  },
  "ava": {
    "require": [
      "@babel/register"
    ]
  }
}
name: package.json
